issue.title: Add AVX2/AESNI versions of SPHINCS+
issue.body:
Currently, only the portable implementations are available in liboqs. The sped-up versions are much faster.

I might take a stab at this myself as I'll need those implementations anyway.

issue.title: Niginx and Curl connectivity like TLS and CMS demo
issue.body:
Hello Team,

I have built the keys using curl and nginx but i am not able to shocase the demo in the same way i was able to do in the TLS and CMS demo.
Can you please provide the elaborated method to do the same.

**Curl :**
$ curl --curves kyber512 https://localhost:4433
curl: option --curves: is unknown
curl: try 'curl --help' for more information
/ $ curl https://localhost:4433
140541562432840:error:141F7065:SSL routines:final_key_share:no suitable key share:ssl/statem/extensions.c:1389:
curl: (35) error:14094410:SSL routines:ssl3_read_bytes:sslv3 alert handshake failure

**Nginx:**
On browsing the site https://localhost:4433 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28886647/80452856-c12db100-8944-11ea-9ed0-1a04b0f0d020.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28886647/80452952-fcc87b00-8944-11ea-93cc-054152b4582b.png)




**httpd:**
Subject=CN = httpd.demo.openquantumsafe.or
issuer=CN = oqstest CA

---
No client certificate CA names sent
Peer signature type: qTesla-I-p
Server Temp Key: saber
---
SSL handshake has read 21667 bytes and written 1365 bytes
Verification error: unable to verify the first certificate
---
New, TLSv1.3, Cipher is TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
Server public key is 119040 bit
Secure Renegotiation IS NOT supported
Compression: NONE
Expansion: NONE
No ALPN negotiated
Early data was not sent
Verify return code: 21 (unable to verify the first certificate)
---
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28886647/80453399-cb03e400-8945-11ea-9a9c-3b1ce209b59a.png)

issue.title: Doxygen file in windows
issue.body:
Hello Team,

As mentioned in the step4 of linux
To generate HTML documentation of the API, run:

 **ninja gen_docs**

The same way , there is no such index.html i have found in docs/doxygen/html/index.html in winodws 10 compilation.

Is these html files provide us API that we can use to create a demo. Can you please provide me the file structure of the html file.

issue.title: CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release causes an build error
issue.body:
```
[archie@archlinux build]$ cmake -GNinja -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release ..
-- The C compiler identification is GNU 9.3.0
-- The ASM compiler identification is GNU
-- Found assembler: /usr/bin/cc
-- Check for working C compiler: /usr/bin/cc
-- Check for working C compiler: /usr/bin/cc - works
-- Detecting C compiler ABI info
-- Detecting C compiler ABI info - done
-- Detecting C compile features
-- Detecting C compile features - done
-- Looking for pthread.h
-- Looking for pthread.h - found
-- Performing Test CMAKE_HAVE_LIBC_PTHREAD
-- Performing Test CMAKE_HAVE_LIBC_PTHREAD - Failed
-- Check if compiler accepts -pthread
-- Check if compiler accepts -pthread - yes
-- Found Threads: TRUE  
-- Found OpenSSL: /usr/lib/libcrypto.so (found suitable version "1.1.1g", minimum required is "1.1.1")  
-- Found Doxygen: /usr/bin/doxygen (found version "1.8.17") found components: doxygen dot 
-- Configuring done
-- Generating done
-- Build files have been written to: /home/archie/Documents/liboqs/build
[archie@archlinux build]$ ninja
[36/956] Building C object src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/aes/aes_ossl.c.o
FAILED: src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/aes/aes_ossl.c.o 
/usr/bin/cc  -Iinclude -O3 -DNDEBUG -fPIC -fvisibility=hidden   -Werror -Wall -Wextra -Wpedantic -Wstrict-prototypes -Wshadow -Wformat=2 -Wfloat-equal -Wwrite-strings -O3 -fomit-frame-pointer -fdata-sections -ffunction-sections -Wl,--gc-sections -Wbad-function-cast -std=gnu11 -MD -MT src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/aes/aes_ossl.c.o -MF src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/aes/aes_ossl.c.o.d -o src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/aes/aes_ossl.c.o   -c ../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c: In function ‘OQS_AES128_ECB_load_schedule’:
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c:16:50: error: unused parameter ‘key’ [-Werror=unused-parameter]
   16 | void OQS_AES128_ECB_load_schedule(const uint8_t *key, void **schedule, int for_encryption) {
      |                                   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~
In file included from include/oqs/oqs.h:14,
                 from ../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c:4:
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c: In function ‘OQS_AES128_ECB_enc_sch’:
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c:60:40: error: variable ‘plaintext_len_int’ set but not used [-Werror=unused-but-set-variable]
   60 |  SIZE_T_TO_INT_OR_ABORT(plaintext_len, plaintext_len_int)
      |                                        ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
include/oqs/common.h:27:7: note: in definition of macro ‘SIZE_T_TO_INT_OR_ABORT’
   27 |   int int_var_name = 0;                                                        \
      |       ^~~~~~~~~~~~
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c:59:29: error: unused variable ‘ks’ [-Werror=unused-variable]
   59 |  const struct key_schedule *ks = (const struct key_schedule *) schedule;
      |                             ^~
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c:58:6: error: unused variable ‘outlen’ [-Werror=unused-variable]
   58 |  int outlen;
      |      ^~~~~~
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c:56:44: error: unused parameter ‘plaintext’ [-Werror=unused-parameter]
   56 | void OQS_AES128_ECB_enc_sch(const uint8_t *plaintext, const size_t plaintext_len, const void *schedule, uint8_t *ciphertext) {
      |                             ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~~~~~~~
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c:56:114: error: unused parameter ‘ciphertext’ [-Werror=unused-parameter]
   56 | void OQS_AES128_ECB_enc_sch(const uint8_t *plaintext, const size_t plaintext_len, const void *schedule, uint8_t *ciphertext) {
      |                                                                                                         ~~~~~~~~~^~~~~~~~~~
In file included from include/oqs/oqs.h:14,
                 from ../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c:4:
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c: In function ‘OQS_AES128_ECB_dec_sch’:
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c:70:41: error: variable ‘ciphertext_len_int’ set but not used [-Werror=unused-but-set-variable]
   70 |  SIZE_T_TO_INT_OR_ABORT(ciphertext_len, ciphertext_len_int)
      |                                         ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
include/oqs/common.h:27:7: note: in definition of macro ‘SIZE_T_TO_INT_OR_ABORT’
   27 |   int int_var_name = 0;                                                        \
      |       ^~~~~~~~~~~~
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c:69:29: error: unused variable ‘ks’ [-Werror=unused-variable]
   69 |  const struct key_schedule *ks = (const struct key_schedule *) schedule;
      |                             ^~
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c:68:6: error: unused variable ‘outlen’ [-Werror=unused-variable]
   68 |  int outlen;
      |      ^~~~~~
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c:66:44: error: unused parameter ‘ciphertext’ [-Werror=unused-parameter]
   66 | void OQS_AES128_ECB_dec_sch(const uint8_t *ciphertext, const size_t ciphertext_len, const void *schedule, uint8_t *plaintext) {
      |                             ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~~~~~~~~
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c:66:116: error: unused parameter ‘plaintext’ [-Werror=unused-parameter]
   66 | void OQS_AES128_ECB_dec_sch(const uint8_t *ciphertext, const size_t ciphertext_len, const void *schedule, uint8_t *plaintext) {
      |                                                                                                           ~~~~~~~~~^~~~~~~~~
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c: In function ‘OQS_AES256_ECB_load_schedule’:
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c:76:50: error: unused parameter ‘key’ [-Werror=unused-parameter]
   76 | void OQS_AES256_ECB_load_schedule(const uint8_t *key, void **schedule, int for_encryption) {
      |                                   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c: In function ‘OQS_AES256_CTR_sch’:
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c:149:6: error: unused variable ‘out_len_output’ [-Werror=unused-variable]
  149 |  int out_len_output;
      |      ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~
../src/common/aes/aes_ossl.c:144:29: error: unused variable ‘ks’ [-Werror=unused-variable]
  144 |  const struct key_schedule *ks = (const struct key_schedule *) schedule;
      |                             ^~
cc1: all warnings being treated as errors
[45/956] Building C object src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/sha3/sha3_c.c.o
ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.
```
The error remains if OQS_USE_OPENSSL is disabled.
```
[51/951] Building C object src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/aes/aes_c.c.o
FAILED: src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/aes/aes_c.c.o 
/usr/bin/cc  -Iinclude -O3 -DNDEBUG -fPIC -fvisibility=hidden   -Werror -Wall -Wextra -Wpedantic -Wstrict-prototypes -Wshadow -Wformat=2 -Wfloat-equal -Wwrite-strings -O3 -fomit-frame-pointer -fdata-sections -ffunction-sections -Wl,--gc-sections -Wbad-function-cast -std=gnu11 -MD -MT src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/aes/aes_c.c.o -MF src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/aes/aes_c.c.o.d -o src/common/CMakeFiles/common.dir/aes/aes_c.c.o   -c ../src/common/aes/aes_c.c
../src/common/aes/aes_c.c: In function ‘OQS_AES256_CTR_sch’:
../src/common/aes/aes_c.c:520:11: error: ‘ctr’ may be used uninitialized in this function [-Werror=maybe-uninitialized]
  520 |  uint32_t ctr;
      |           ^~~
cc1: all warnings being treated as errors
[60/951] Building C object src/kem/sike/CMakeFiles/sike.dir/P751/P751_compressed.c.o
ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.
```
